choices.text: IV Methylprednisolone is preferred drug in emergency
Belimumab is an approved anti-CD20 antibody for SLE treatment
Vitamin D3 supplementation reduces disease activity.
Hydroxychloroquine is the cornerstone of SLE therapy

questions.text: Following statements about SLE are true EXCEPT:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Belimumab is a monoclonal antibody against B-lymphocyte stimulator (Blys), found to reduce disease activity and possibly decrease the number of severe flares and steroid use in patients with SLE when used in combination with standard therapy.

Vitamin D3 deficiency is more common in SLE patients and supplementation is helpful.

Hydroxychloroquine is the cornerstone of therapy and also safe in pregnancy.

questions.text: The earliest finding on nailfold capillaroscopy in Systemic sclerosis is
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Congestion of capillaries

questions.text: The most specific pattern of Immunofluorescence in SLE is
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Rim pattern

Rim pattern corresponds to the presence of Anti-sm and hence most specific.

Speckled is most common pattern in SLE cases though it is not specific.

questions.text: A 35 year old woman presents to the Rheumatology clinic with mask-like face and shortening of the digits. The patient was diagnosed as a case of systemic sclerosis. Which is the best treatment for renal involvement in this case?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

ACEI
The renal involvement in Systemic sclerosis is due to the Glomerular capillary involvement i.e. microangiopathy. This responds best to early use of ACEI therapy.

questions.text: Lupus Nephritis is which type of Hypersensitivity reaction
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Type 3 Hypersensitivity reaction

Lupus nephritis is due to immune complex deposits on the GBM.

questions.text: What is the most common Autoimmune disease causing Mononeuritis multiplex
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Polyarteritis nodosa

The most common autoimmune cause of MNM is PAN>SSc>Sicca syndrome

questions.text: A young woman presents with facial puffiness and history of Raynaud’s phenomenon in the past. She is tested positive for ANA and capillaroscopy shows congested capillaries. Which antibody test can be diagnostic of CREST syndrome?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Anti-centromere antibody
CREST syndrome (Limited SSc) is suspected when skin involvement is limited to the face and distal to the elbows. The diagnostic antibody is Anti-Centromere antibody. The prognostic antibody is Anti-Fibrillin/Anti-U3RNP antibody which predicts risk of PAH and RPGN.

choices.text: Pulmonary hypertension is more common in the Diffuse type of SSc
Mild cases can be treated with Bosentan
Iloprost is preferred in cases with Heart failure
Anti-U1RNP predicts risk of Pulmonary hypertension

questions.text: In Systemic sclerosis, Pulmonary hypertension is a dreaded complication. All the statements are true regarding the disease EXCEPT
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Anti-U1RNP predicts risk of Pulmonary hypertension 
The prognostic antibody is Anti-Fibrillin/Anti-U3RNP antibody which predicts risk of PAH and RPGN.

choices.text: Both ANA and ANCA are Positive

questions.text: A 30 year-old male presents with livedo changes on the skin with asymmetrical neuropathy. He is diagnosed case of Hepatitis B infection. Following statements are  true about the condition EXCEPT
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Both ANA and ANCA are Positive
The case described is Polyarteritis nodosa which is an immune complex mediated medium vessel vasculitis. Pulmonary involvement is rare due to bronchial artery involvement. Gonadal artery involvement can occur causing abdominal pain mimicking Torsion. However, Both ANA and ANCA HAVE TO BE NEGATIVE.

questions.text: The following are the ANCA-mediated Pulmonary renal syndromes EXCEPT
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Henoch Schloein purpura

choices.text: It is an Autosomal dominant defect
MRI screening for Berry Aneursym is indicated

questions.text: A young male presents with history of episodic hematuria associated with deafness. On examination, he has a subcapsular cataract. Which of the following is expected in this condition?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

All are false statements
The case described is Alports syndrome which is a X-linked defect of COL4A5 gene defect. It presents with the triad of Episodic hematuria, Deafness and lens defect. 
Berry Aneussym in brain, Hyperoxaluria, MVP, EPO-secreting tumour are all defects associated with ADPKD- Autosomal dominant forms of polycystic kidney disease.

questions.text: Urate crystals are described as having the following shape:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Long and needle like

questions.text: The most common joint affected in pseudogout is
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Knees

Knee joint is most common joint affected in pseudogout followed by the hip and the shoulder joints.

questions.text: A 30-year-old female presents with a photosensitive macular rash over the maxilla to a dermatology clinic. She also has pain in the joints for the past 6 months for which she is on NSAIDS. However, there is no deformity. She has no haematuria or dysuria. Urine analysis reveals 3+ proteinuria with granular cast. Which of the following tests are not indicated to confirm the diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

 

According to the EULAR update for diagnosis of SLE, the following immunological tests are indicated to confirm diagnosis in a suspected SLE patient.
1. ANA,         2. Anti-sm,             3. Anti-dsDNA, 
4. Anti-Phospholipid antibody,  6. Low Serum C3 levels.
Direct coomb’s test is neither specific nor sensitive for the diagnosis of SLE and hence has been now approved only for prognosis in confirmed cases of SLE.

questions.text: A 44-year-old lady presents to the clinic with shortening of the digits in her hands. She has an history of pallor of extremities followed by pain and cyanosis on exposure to cold during her adolescence. 6months back she had noticed puffiness of her fingers and face. ANA was positive with Nucleolar pattern of immunofluorescence. What is the likely diagnosis.
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Nucleolar pattern of ANA correlates with Anti-topoisomerase 1 antibody which is specific for Diffuse SSc.

questions.text: A 35 years old man presents to you with a 2-month history of pain in his small joints of hands. On examination, nail peeling is noted. What is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Psoriatic arthritis – Spondyloarthropathy with Skin and Nail changes.

questions.text: A 76 year old man presents to emergency department with pain in his knees. He describes the pain as been worse at evening and after exertion. On examination, Heber dens nodules are palpable at the DIP. X-ray shows reduction in joint space, subchondral sclerosis and osteophyte formation. What is the most appropriate treatment.
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

NSAIDS and regular follow-up. The patient is suffering from OA.

questions.text: A 20-year-old man presents with sudden pain in the right eye, with associated blurred vision and discomfort while gazing at the lights. He has a history of low backpain. MRI revealed sacroiliitis. What is the most likely cause of his eye pain:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Anterior uveitis. 
Ankylosing spondylosis (AS) also Marie Strumpell/ Bechetrow’s disease. 
•    The only Male Dominant Axial arthropathy. It is a part of spondylo-arthropathies which present with extra-articular manifestation. Majority present with recurrent, unilateral anterior uveitis.

questions.text: 20-year female comes with pain in both knee joint (right>Left) for 20 days. On examination, following finding seen. The probable diagnosis is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Keratoderma Blennorrhagia is typically seen in Reactive arthritis.

questions.text: All of the following are associated with Granulomatous Pathology except:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

PAN is an immune complex mediated vasculitis.

questions.text: Which organ is spared in Wegener’s granulomatosis:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Liver is spared in Wegener’s granulomatosis.

questions.text: False positive RA Factor is seen in all EXCEPT:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Serology: Rheumatoid factors (autoantibodies reactive with the Fc portion of IgG): Widely utilized tests mainly detect IgM rheumatoid factors. Sensitive test but non-specific.
False positive RA factor: Systemic lupus erythematosus, Sjogren's syndrome, chronic liver disease, sarcoidosis, interstitial pulmonary fibrosis, infectious mononucleosis, hepatitis B, tuberculosis, leprosy, syphilis, subacute bacterial endocarditis, visceral leishmaniasis, schistosomiasis, and malaria.

choices.text: Patient has features of SLE, SSc and Myositis
Presence of Anti-U1RNP is specific for MCTD
Prognosis is worse than individual disorders.

questions.text: Following statements are true regarding overlap syndrome EXCEPT:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Prognosis is worse than individual disorders.

Overlap syndrome is not uncommon in Rheumatology clinic considering that all diseases share common pathology i.e. autoimmunity. In a young patient with features of SLE, SSc and Myositis with both ANA & RAF positive, Overlap syndrome is diagnosed. Presence of Anti-U1RNP is specific for MCTD. However the response to treatment is favourable and hence the prognosis is better than individual disorders.

questions.text: A 30-year-old male presented with Raynaud’s phenomenon ad hematuria. On examination he has asymmetrical neuropathy. Laboratory test revealed he is Hepatitis B positive. Renal Angiography revealed microaneurysm at the bifurcation. What is the diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Polyarteritis Nodosa

Systemic necrotising vasculitis is the other name for Polyarteritis nodosa (PAN) as it causes fibrinoid necrosis of the medium sized arteries. It is the only arteritis to cause haematuria without GN due to rupture of microaneurysms (on Renal angiography). Gonadal artery involvement can mimic acute abdomen. Skin involvement and mono-neuritis multiplex are common associations. It spares the pulmonary circulation though the bronchial arteries maybe affected in 1-2%of the cases.

questions.text: Most specific antibody to diagnose RA is
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Anti CCP is the most specific Ab of RA and Anti Smith Ab is the most specific Ab of SLE.
